marketNews.title: US Core Inflation Below Expectations, Rate Cut Hopes Increase
marketNews.content: The US Bureau of Statistics on Wednesday (1/15) local time announced that US core inflation eased on an annual basis in December 2024 and was below expectations, although headline inflation increased. Here are the details: YoY Inflation: 2.9% (vs. consensus: 2.9%; Nov 2024: 2.7%) MoM Inflation: 0.4% (vs. consensus: 0.3%; Nov 2024: 0.3%) Core Inflation YoY: 3.2% (vs. consensus: 3.3%; Nov 2024: 3.3%) Core Inflation MoM: 0.2% (vs. consensus: 0.2%; Nov 2024: 0.3%). The development above reopens market participants' hopes for a greater prospect of US interest rate cuts. Before this data release, the market tended to be pessimistic along with the higher-for-longer narrative, with the Fed only expected to cut interest rates by 25 bps this year. According to analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool as of Thursday (16/1), the probability of the Fed cutting US interest rates by more than 25 bps in 2025 rose to 45%, from the previous level of 34.8% on January 14, 2025. Following the inflation data release, the US stock markets closed stronger on Wednesday (15/1), with DJI +1.6%, S&P 500 +1.8%, and Nasdaq +2.4%. On the same day, the US dollar index (DXY) fell -0.16% to 109.1 and the 10-year US government bond yield fell -14 bps to 4.653%. In Indonesia, the IHSG closed stronger +0.39% on Thursday (16/1), while the 10-year Indonesian government bond yield fell -9 bps to 7.172% and the Rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar weakened -0.24% to 16,360. The Head of the Monetary Management and Asset Management Department of Bank Indonesia, Edi Susianto, stated that the weakening of the Rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar is still under control. Edi mentioned that the Rupiah weakening is short-term because market participants are still digesting Bank Indonesia's decision to cut the BI Rate by -25 bps to 5.75% yesterday, Wednesday (15/1). Key Takeaway Although the increase in The Fed's rate cut expectations is fresh air for Indonesia, we assess that the market will still tend to be volatile until further clarity emerges regarding the new US government policy which has the potential to influence interest rate direction. Donald Trump is scheduled to be inaugurated as the US President on January 20, 2024, local time. Meanwhile, the nearest Fed meeting schedule will take place on January 28-29, 2024, local time. To face volatility from the rate narrative that can change at any time, investors can lock in high short-term FR bond yields which still have low volatility, such as PBS003 (maturing in 2 years) offering a yield of 6.79% per year. *This article was first published in Stockbit Commentary on Thursday (16/1) morning.

marketNews.title: Qatar Prime Minister stated that Israel and Hamas have agreed on a ceasefire and hostage release agreement by Sunday (19/1), conditional on approval by the Israeli cabinet. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated that the final details of the agreement are still being worked out. Meanwhile, Hamas leader Khalil al-Hayya said the agreement is the result of Palestinian "resilience."
marketNews.content: The Prime Minister of Qatar, Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdul Rahman Al Thani, stated on Wednesday (15/1) that Israel and Hamas have agreed on a ceasefire and hostage release agreement by Sunday (19/1), conditional on approval by the Israeli cabinet. Israeli Prime Minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, mentioned that the final details of the agreement are still being worked out. Meanwhile, Hamas leader, Khalil al-Hayya, said the agreement is the result of Palestinian "resilience."

marketNews.title: The Government Plans to Increase Electricity Capacity by 71 GW in the Electricity Supply Business Plan (RUPTL) for the 2025-2034 Period
marketNews.content: The government plans to increase electricity capacity up to 71 GW in the draft electricity supply business plan (RUPTL) for the 2025-2034 period. Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, stated on Wednesday (15/1) that 70% of this electricity capacity is targeted to come from new and renewable energy (EBT). In a separate occasion, Deputy Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Kartika Wirjoatmodjoedjo, mentioned that the 2025-2034 RUPTL will be finalized in January 2025.

marketNews.title: Gapki Projects CPO Exports to Drop by 2 Million Tons in 2025 Due to B40 Mandatory Implementation
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Palm Oil Producers Association (Gapki), Eddy Martono, stated that they project the implementation of the mandatory B40 biodiesel will cut Indonesian CPO export volume by 2 million tons during 2025, considering that national CPO production is expected to remain stagnant. This amount is equivalent to 7% of the annualized CPO export volume in 9M24.

marketNews.title: Anindya Bakrie Officially Assumes Chairmanship of Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Kadin) for the 2024-2029 Period
marketNews.content: Anindya Bakrie officially serves as the general chairman of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Kadin) for the 2024-2029 period based on the consolidation national working meeting plenary session of Kadin on Thursday (16/1). Meanwhile, Arsjad Rasjid, who previously served as general chairman, was appointed as the chairman of the Kadin Indonesia advisory board. The Chairman of the Kadin Indonesia Honorary Council, Rosan Roeslani, confirmed that there is no division or dualism within the Kadin Indonesia internal structure following this decision.

marketNews.title: Luhut Suggests Establishing Family Office Starting February 2025
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the National Economic Council, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, stated on Wednesday (15/1) that he plans to propose to President Prabowo Subianto that the family office can begin operation in February 2025.

tickerNews.title: BBNI Opens Opportunity to Increase Dividend Payout Ratio
tickerNews.content: BBNI: The President Director of Bank Negara Indonesia, Royke Tumilaar, stated on Wednesday (15/1) that the company will likely raise the dividend payout ratio to the range of 55-60% for the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution. In the previous year, BBNI distributed a dividend payout ratio of 50% of its 2023 net profit. Royke mentioned that the increase in dividend payment will not affect BBNI because the company has strong capital adequacy.

tickerNews.title: Minister Erick Thohir to Receive Report on BTN Syariah Spin-off This Week
tickerNews.content: BBTN: The Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, stated on Thursday (16/1) that he will receive a report from the President Director of Bank Tabungan Negara, Nixon L. P. Napitupulu, regarding the spin-off of BTN Syariah this week. Previously, Nixon stated in mid-December 2024 that the bank acquisition process would be completed in 1Q25, with the spin-off of BTN Syariah expected to finish in mid-2025. BBTN itself mentioned in November 2024 that the company was negotiating and arranging a conditional sale and purchase agreement to acquire a bank, although it did not elaborate further.

tickerNews.title: Barito Renewables BREN Targets Additional 41 MW Capacity from Geothermal Project in 2025
tickerNews.content: BREN: The Director of Barito Renewables Energy, Merly, stated that the company targets an additional power generation capacity from geothermal development projects of 41 MW in 2025, so that the total geothermal power plant (PLTP) capacity operated by the company will increase to 907 MW. Previously, BREN announced in October 2024 its plan to budget 346 million US dollars for the next 3 years to add 104.6 MW of capacity. Merly also mentioned that the additional capacity from wind power plants will effectively contribute to BREN's revenue in 2026.

tickerNews.title: INKP and TKIM Announce Change in Controlling Shareholder for Leadership Succession
tickerNews.content: INKP: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper and Pabrik Kertas Tjiwi Kimia (TKIM) announced a change in the last controlling shareholder from Oei Tjie Goan (Teguh Ganda Wijaya) to Jackson Wijaya Limantara, the son of Teguh Ganda Wijaya. This is intended in the framework of leadership succession to maintain the continuity and sustainability of the company's business activities.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Controller Purchases ~3.6 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: AKRA: The controller of AKR Corporindo, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, purchased ~3.6 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,189 rupiah per share on January 10-13, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~4.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Arthakencana Rayatama in AKRA increased from 63.619% to 63.637%.

tickerNews.title: SUNI Wins Tender from PT Pertamina Hulu Sanga Sanga for Casing Procurement
tickerNews.content: SUNI: Sunindo Pratama announced that the company has won the casing procurement tender from PT Pertamina Hulu Sanga Sanga with a bid value of ~130 billion rupiah. SUNI stated that this tender is expected to contribute to the company's revenue and operating profit in 2025-2026.

tickerNews.title: TRIN Achieved Marketing Sales of IDR 1.89 Trillion in 2024, Exceeding Target, Aims for IDR 1.8 Trillion in 2025
tickerNews.content: TRIN: The President Director of Perintis Triniti Properti, Ishak Chandra, stated that the company recorded marketing sales of 1.89 trillion rupiah during 2024 (+81% YoY), far exceeding (126%) the 2024 target of 1.5 trillion rupiah. TRIN itself targets marketing sales of 1.8 trillion rupiah in 2025, which is based on the increasingly conducive prospect of the property industry.

tickerNews.title: Bank Indonesia Confirms Rupiah Weakness is Under Control Following BI Rate Cut
tickerNews.content: The Head of the Monetary Management and Asset Management Department of Bank Indonesia, Edi Susianto, told Reuters that the weakening of the Rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar is still under control. Edi mentioned that the Rupiah weakening is short-term because market participants are still digesting Bank Indonesia's decision to cut the BI Rate by -25 bps to the level of 5.75% yesterday, Wednesday (15/1). Edi also said Bank Indonesia will ensure the supply and demand of foreign exchange in the market. Edi's statement emerged after the Rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar fell -0.4% to 16,383 on Thursday (16/1) morning, at a time when other Asian currencies, such as the Japanese Yen, Malaysian Ringgit, and Indian Rupee strengthened against the US dollar.

tickerNews.title: CPRO Accelerated Repayment of Senior Facility Tranche B Debt in December 2024
tickerNews.content: Central Proteina Prima (CPRO) announced that it has accelerated the repayment of the senior facility agreement tranche B debt in December 2024, meaning the company has fully repaid the entire senior facility agreement debt. As of September 2024, CPRO had a senior facility agreement tranche B debt of 10.2 million US dollars.
